TopicTitle: Challenge: Duna and Ike probe grand tour

Articles.Content:
Would it be cool if NASA sent an uncrewed probe to Mars and it's moons phobos and deimos. Sadly not now but what if Gene and Von Kerman requested a launch to Duna and Ike and get a whole trip. 

So one day it happened

KSC requests a grand tour of Duna and Ike. Sadly none of the kerbals volunteered as it would be too scary of a trip. Here is the score card.

Points

Bold for Required already

Arrive at Duna and get science for high and low orbits +100 points

Land at Duna +100 points

Arrive at Ike and get science for high and low orbits +100 points

Land at Ike +100 points

No crew + 400 points

full reusable lander for both bodies +150 points

Every biome accomplished on Duna +850 points

Every biome accomplished on Ike +500 Points

Return and land at Kerbin +150 points

Make a video for our challenge video results + 250 points

No RTGS + 250

Under 500000 (for spacecraft cost) +550 points

No relay + 100 points

All science accomplished (all autonomous experiments [meaning deploy-able gear isn't on the list as well as science lab]) +1000 points

No rover + 400 points

Complete all the following above +500 points

Total possible flight score: 4650

Lander requirements

The lander must be a direct ascent lander. Meaning no multiple launches or docking a separate lander.

You can

single stage lander

two stage lander (lander stage and return stage)

Deploy-able lander (expands and folds back into to make less space)

You can't

glider lander

radical decoupled lander (EX: putting duna parachutes on the side and then decouple them after doing all duna landings)

Submissions date

This will close on December 30th 2019.  winners announced a few days after. 

Reward:

You will be submitted to have a program named after yourself. In my space program we name stuff after certain people who decided that name. your name will be in a program that is not announced yet. And don't worry... you will be famous

Edited June 23, 2019 by Guest
